campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
CAMPAIGN

As with any crowdfunding campaign, we need your help to make this a reality by reaching our funding goal. Help us make the dream come true!

Our brushes are produced by the talented brushmakers at DaVinci Brushes, which is why we are confident in delivering a product of high quality. All shipments are hand-packed and shipped via Fantasia North. However, as with any international operation, unforeseen complications may arise. Especially during a global pandemic we may hit unpredictable snags with interrupted production, delayed shipping, or a range of other possible issues. If any problems should arise with your shipment, do not hesitate to contact us at Sales@squidmar.com! All reports are individually processed by the staff of Fantasia North. 

Because of these possible inconveniences and problems, communication is key. This is doubly true in the chaos of Covid-19. This is why we’re intending to keep all of you up to date on any complications which may arise, and how this might affect the Kickstarter campaign.

Our intention is to deliver regular updates to you guys, and keep you in the loop. Don’t worry, if anything happens, you’ll be the first to know! If you have any questions, feel free to mail us at Sales@squidmar.com. 

Due to extremely high demand, all pledges made after June 23rd will be shipped in december. 

CROWDOX

Our Kickstarter campaign is partnered with the pledge manager CrowdOx. CrowdOx, beyond helping us manage our campaign, offers a range of services for you as a pledgee. All shipping costs will be handled through CrowdOx, and will thus not be processed through Kickstarter itself, and CrowdOx will double check to make sure your shipping address is the correct one. 

After the Kickstarter campaign has concluded, CrowdOx will send you a survey, through which you can increase your pledge or add additional products to your order. These additional products include, amongst other things, single brushes, brush soap, exclusive t-shirts and display plinths for your miniatures. Increasing your pledge, adding additional products, or both, will incur no additional fees or processing costs. 

REFUND POLICY 

You are entitled to a full refund, including any fees, within 14 days of the end of the Kickstarter campaign, no questions asked. After that date we have no way to refund any processing or Kickstarter fees, but we can still refund the cost of the product. If, however, the brushes or busts are already being processed for shipping, or have already been shipped, we can unfortunately not refund the payment. If a product is lost in shipping, or cannot be delivered to you at all, we will fully refund the purchase, fees and all.

This project is based on Swedish currency, SEK, and all purchases or refunds applicable are processed in SEK. All refunds are processed through Fantasia North, and refund inquiries are to be directed to the Sales@squidmar.com email address. 

TERMS AND CONDITIONS

If you do not accept the terms and conditions found below, please do not contribute to our Kickstarter campaign. By placing a pledge to this Kickstarter project you acknowledge that the products being funded may differ substantially in design, material or make from their presentation during the period which the Kickstarter was active. 

This Kickstarter campaign makes use of SEK, Swedish currency, and all other currency values shown in media concerning the campaign are estimations, including but not exclusive to the Kickstarter page and any promotional videos published on our YouTube channel. The final purchasing price is therefore sensitive to market fluctuations of currency exchanges, and may differ from any estimated prices published by us.

If you have not confirmed your pledge within 12 weeks of our confirmation email, you acknowledge that we have fulfilled any and all obligations to you for payments or donations pledged. Pledges confirmed after this 12 week period may, at our full discretion, be either refunded or shipped. Note that confirmation is extremely important, and any non-confirmed pledges are deprioritized in regards to any limited quantity items, or in the event of product shortages or delays. All backers that have selected to no receive a reward on Kickstarter that wish to receive a reward must confirm their order by the Pledge Manager deadline. Any pledge still on “No Reward” by that date will be treated as a donation.

By confirming your pledge within the 12 week time period from receiving the confirmation email, you acknowledge that our responsibility to you entails shipping the product in accordance to the shipping plan applicable to your region as detailed on our Kickstarter page. You also acknowledge that title and risk passes to you upon delivery to common carrier of this form of shipment, and that you are responsible for import duties or other duties applicable to your region or relevant tax authority, providing correct address information to an address deliverable by normal shipment methods. 

Thank you for reviewing our terms and conditions. Let us reiterate that if you do not agree to these terms and conditions, consider not pledging to this campaign.

updates.update_content:
Hey everyone, we've got good news! Monday and Tuesday we got the last packages picked up by DHL! And we're so happy to finally be done! There's a few exceptions, about 20 orders that there are errors on for various reasons, we'll reach out to you once we figure out what's wrong with each specific one and what we can do to sort it for you.

If you have any questions or issues: sales@squidmar.com will help

We finally got an update, I got an email from the shipping company today, the package with the final busts is in Sweden and is said to be delivered to us TODAY! There will be a few hundred busts for us to then repack so they are shippable to you - but we're so happy things are moving again finally and that we see the light at the end of the tunnel! Hopefully i can give an update with estimated time on when the stuff leaves from us to you on Monday.

If you're a late pledger, this means that once we have these 400 shipped out to the KS backers, your stuff is next - and already prepared to be transported to you!

Hey everyone, so we managed to get the first of the bust packages delivered to us, meaning that we've been able to ship out about 450 packages since last week. 

Meaning that there's just about 400 backers now that have not received their packages. We're terribly sorry for the wait you guys had to endure - and we cannot state enough how badly we just want to get it out to you already.

Hey everyone, hope you're all OK despite the third wave going on around the world. As we're nearing the end of fulfillment for the campaign, we have still about 900 orders to deliver, and hope to get out 2-300 of those at the beginning of this week. 

Why haven't we sent out more or sent out all of the last stuff: Our current bottleneck is bust copies of Zion&Dea (the ork bust). There are two big shipments on the way to us from the caster thats was shipped with express shipping about 2 and 2,5 weeks ago and we have still not received them. Packages that normally would take 3-4 days for us to receive have already been delayed 10+ days. It's so frustrating to not be able to ship out the final orders yet and we can only assume you feel the same.  We guess its a sign of the covid times. And its really really frustrating.

Hey Everyone, good news! I just published the video with Craftworld painting the bust of Eira!

It's quite fascinating to see someone paint so differently from yourself, both in brush control but also in the use of colors! I hope you'll enjoy it and it gives you some inspiration for your own painting!

Hey everyone! We've got another positive update today, the masterclass video for Illonth is finally online! We're working on the Eira one as we speak that Craftworld recorded, to get it ready for publishing in hopefully a week!

It's been an intense project and after today we calculated that we've spent at least 120 man hours on the recording and edit! We hope you enjoy and learn from it as much as we did making it.

Just a quick update this week. We managed to get about 1000 orders out yesterday to DHL, Andreas and his colleagues have been doing a great job! We also managed to get most Swedish orders out on top of this as they go through a different system.

We got another box of busts delivered on monday too, about 500 busts which means that we'll hopefully be able to ship at least that many packages next week as well.

updates.update_userinfo: Part of Final bust stuff have arrived!
updates.update_content: Hey everyone, good news for all the bust/all in orders! We have finally gotten the final parts we need to start shipping busts & all in packages. After this we're getting somewhere around 4-500 more busts every week unless there's any more issues in shipping to us/production/covid etc.

Hey everyone,

Where ever you are in the world and what ever you're celebrating (or not) we wish you great holidays! After a three days off for Christmas with our families - We've been hard att work to pack the busts and still shipping out as much as we can. We've gotten final stuff for everything except for the stuff for the Hilma bust, that should be with us any day now. It should have already, but covid and december seem to have messed up shipping times even more.

campaign.story:
PLAY

THE TEAM HAS BEEN HARD AT WORK. THANK YOU FOR ALL YOUR SUPPORT
FIRST, EVERYONE GETS A FREE DIGITAL OR PHYSICAL POSTER AS A THANK YOU FOR GETTING US THIS FAR!
We couldn't have done this without you and the team is so excited for the chance to expand the universe of The Bone Herder and the world of Koatrom! For now, all art will be done by Tumo, Sam, and Morgan. All writing, for now, will be done by me, Zaire. :)
The team is very excited about the opportunity to expand the Universe of The Bone Herder and explore the world of Koatrom. We hope that you are too. Continue to share the campaign. None of this would be happening without each and everyone one of you! 
Stretch Goal List
 STRETCH GOAL BREAKDOWN - PART 1
$40,000 - Digital Wallpapers
Digital wallpapers illustrated by Tumo, Morgan, and Sam. They will be various ratios so they can fit on various screens. The pictures will be taken from concept art and further stretch goals
$50,000 - A Bone Herder's Tool Guide
This digital PDF details the Bone Herders tools and tricks with illustrations. What's a Bone Herder carry everyday? What's the purpose of each knife? What knife does Analleli use for a sandwich? Find out here.
$60,000 - A Conservationists Account of Koatrom’s Animals
An illustrated Digital PDF of the animals roaming Koatrom as noted by Jotan, a renowned conservationist of the country.
STRETCH GOAL BREAKDOWN - PART 2
$70,000 - Shadow Trackers Guide to Rare and Unseen Creatures
What creatures lurk in the shadows of Koatrom’s landscapes? Shadow Tracker Kytune regales the reader with tales of inhuman creatures in this illustrated guide
$80,000 - Tel'we's Short History of Koatrom
Digital PDF journal of various aspects of Koatrom’s history, culture, and lands as gathered by Tel’we, Koatrom's famous Nomadic Historian.
$120,000 - One shot Table Top Game
This is the stretchiest of stretch goals! Our moon landing. This would be one shot table top campaign that takes place in the world of Koatrom. We mostly added this one as a joke...unless....
AGAIN. THANK ALL OF YOU SO MUCH.
THE PROJECT
The Bone Herder is an Afropunk/Afrofuturistic fantasy horror comic that puts black characters at the center of the story. Often people of color are left out of fantasy worlds or forced into stereotypical roles. I'm not alone in my desire to see settings that extend beyond the familiarity of typical western stories. This project originated from Gail Simone's Comic School, which gave me the confidence to go forward with my idea. 
THE SQUAD
Ope, I am Zaire Lanier and I am a writer and narrative designer from the Midwest and I am the writer for The Bone Herder. The sequential artist is Tumo Mere from Botswana and the concept artist is Morgan Madeline. Morgan and Tumo are known for their work in the amazing SWORDSFALL UNIVERSE and more! Sam Willoughby came on to do additional art! Gary Kings and his sister, Harriet did the trailer and music respectively. Please give everyone follows and support!
Zaire: https://twitter.com/Zlanier21     
Tumo: https://twitter.com/ItsTumo  
Morgan: https://twitter.com/mormadillus
Sam: https://twitter.com/SamRWilloughby   
Gary: https://twitter.com/GaryJKings      
Harriet: https://twitter.com/Harriet_FerretE                                             
THE STORY
Every generation, a child is chosen to travel from village to village punishing wrong doers, by flaying their bones and burying them. Cass is the first to break the tradition, but in doing so breaks an ancient pact with the Flesh Folk. 
Preliminary sketch of the first page - Tumo Mere
Colored and Lettered First Page by Tumo Mere
THE WORLD 
The Bone Herder takes place in the mythical country of Koatrom and is inspired by pre-colonial Africa and Afropunk aesthetics. Why Afropunk? It is a battle cry against the norm and a baseline for something different. It isn't easily defined. Fantasy has been built on the shoulders of the Western ideals. While I enjoy it, it does have its issues, prejudices, and hurtful stereotypes. 
This is why  I am creating the world of The Bone Herder. It is for people, like me, that want to a reflection of themselves in the media they consume. My family tree and genealogy have no known origin. Africa is the framework for my existence and I feel an attachment and at times even a hole for a motherland I never knew. I imagine worlds and stories they might have once been a part of many, many years ago.  
I based the world around ancient African cities like Carthage and Kush. The ancient cities of Africa are a rich and diverse world. I have created my own mythos surrounding the mysterious and ancient Flesh Folk. 
While this story is a fantasy horror comic, I want to portray a strong and loving Black family. Cass's family will come strongly into play and we will see the impact that they have on her personhood as the story progresses. 
THE DUO
Anallelli Yosi - Cass's mentor and teacher. Analleli hates what she does, but knows it is necessary. She acts out of a sense of duty.
Analleli Concept Art - Morgan Thomas
Analleli by Tumo Mere
Cass Ilondyri - The forced apprentice to Analleli. She's vowed vengeance against her mentor and wants to end the practice. 
Older Cass by Tumo Mere
Cass Concept Art by Morgan
The Rewards
Logo Pin
Cass Button by Morgan
Analleli Button by Morgan
11x17 Print by Sam
THE SCRIPT
I wanted to show you guys a couple pages of the script :)
Page 1 of Script by Zaire
Page 2 of Script by Zaire
 THE BUDGET
ART 
About half of the funds are going directly to the artists. A lot of Kickstarter comics are already finished, but this isn't the case with Bone Herder. This is helping fund production of the comic, which goes towards myself, Tumo and Morgan, as well as Gary and his sister, who did the trailer and music. We all have already put in so much work and our skills deserve to be properly compensated.
I believe very strongly in paying artist fair rates for their time and skills. I saved and paid out of pocket for a first page and some concept art. They both believed in the script and decided to come on board for the project. I am trying to pay as close to professional rates as possible. Passion does not pay bills, as nice as that would be
PRINTING AND SHIPPING
The rest of the money goes towards printing, getting books bound, posters, etc. 
The Promise
We will be transparent with every step along the way. I promise to treat this comic and work respectfully. I wrote The Bone Herder with people like me in mind, who want to see more diverse characters and stories in comics. Fantasy has always catered to a Western bent. I want to help change that. I modeled the world partially off of ancient African cities like Carthage, Kush, and places that Africa influenced. The ancient world was more colorful than we were taught. 
I am excited about what I have put together with my team. I hope that you are too and that I will see you at the finish line!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is my first Kickstarter. I believe in the concept, but I haven't ever planned a project of this size before. My name isn't out there a ton, but there has been a lot of interest in the comic. 

I believe that my main risk would be attempting to large a scope for my first project. To mitigate this risk, I have been consulting friends and professionals that have run other successful Kickstarters. This ensures that I stay grounded. My artist are being paid through the Kickstarter and I want to make sure that they are able to be paid fairly on time. The rest of the money will be going towards shipping and production costs.

My challenges are mainly keeping an open line of communication with the team since we are working remotely. We have daily checkins and keep each other encouraged and on track.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Hey everyone! Quick check in, several folks have reached out about how to change your address for surveys. I’m going to post a picture below with instructions and also a link to the support page to do so.
Link: https://help.kickstarter.com/hc/en-us/articles/115005126894-How-do-I-provide-a-creator-with-my-shipping-address-and-reward-details-
Scroll down and look for how to change address. You should also be able to find the survey there if you still haven’t filled it out. The ability to change your address closes this coming Monday June 14.

The comics are here! They’ve arrived in 12 gigantic boxes and I have over 1300 books chilling in my living room. It’s a lot, but the books look gorgeous! I can’t wait for y’all to have them in hand :)
I am so excited and I planning to get these out within the next couple weeks. I am locking all address changes this Friday so make sure that you have to correct address on your survey.

Covers and almost there
Tumo just sent over the covers, the letterer sent over the properly formatted files, and I am about to send everything to the layout artist. The end is so close, I could cry! Here's some final images. Within the next week or two, you will have the digital comic in your inboxes.
At the same time, I will be sending over the files to the printer, which will take some time. Printing is still in flux because of the pandemic, BUT, you will be able to read it digitally, which is very exciting! Thank you all for being on this journey with me as we slowly come to the end. Once I get the books from the printer, I will immediately begin the long and arduous process of packing 1500 boxes!! :( :( lol.

Hey everyone!

Some good news and some bad news! Good news, everything is more or less done! Bad news, we had a formatting issue with the comic that resulted in a bad trim that looked very sloppy in physical form. The book that will be published in 2022 will be a lot longer than 25 or so pages

WE SIGNED THE FANCY PAPERS! :D
Ope, I haven't forgotten about yall! The time has finally come! This Friday, Tumo and I finalized the deal with the publisher!! This means that we can move forward with fulfilling the Kickstarter promises.

Hi everyone, 
I have some very exciting news, but first, I have a small request. I know that I have not been great with updates. A lot of my time has been spent waiting for publisher to finalize the contract so that I know how much I can put out to y'all. I should've been better at communicating and I apologize for that and I will be better in the future. However, please do not send me messages with swears or talk poorly about my team. I've had rude comments on Kickstarter, email, and even my private Facebook.

campaign.story:
As a teenager, I got wrapped  up in the amazing images and worlds I found in tabletop roleplaying games. When I finally broke into freelance illustration, I wanted  to give back to the industry in a meaningful way.
I've been asking creators what type of stock art is missing in the industry. The response has been overwhelmingly clear. This project is to fill those gaps for you.
This project will be a collection of 75 to 100 stock illustrations with a Modern, Sci-Fi, or Lovecraft theme. There will be a total of SEVEN categories of artwork:
FONTS - ONE font for each of the Modern, Sci-Fi, and Lovecraft Themes.
FULL PAGE / COVER ART - THREE vertical full page illustrations designed to also be usable as cover art. Each illustration will be divided into foreground, middle, and background images.
VEHICLES - FIVE images of various modes of transportation. These will include up to 3 variants each with a minimum of 12 total variants.*
SCENES - SEVEN half page illustrations of action or display of skill. Like the full page art, these will be broken into foreground, middle, and background images. Each image will include up to 3 variants with a minimum of 15 total variants.*
EFFECTS - NINE images of various effects such as explosions, weather, gunshots, and more. These will be accompanied by an appropriate text effect such as: BOOM, ZAP, CRACK, etc.
CHARACTERS - ELEVEN characters and creatures posed to be used in a scene. Each of these will include up to 3 variants with a minimum of 24 total characters or creatures.*
ITEMS - THIRTEEN illustrations of various items and equipment. These also will have up to 3 variants each with a minimum of 27 total variations.*
*The actual number of variants per illustration will depend upon the complexity of converting the image to another genre.
As usual with most of my projects, illustrations will be chosen from submitted ideas. These ideas will be curated and voted upon to determine the actual contents of this project.
$4,900 - Funding goal.
$5,900 - COVERS will receive full color.
$6,900 -  VEHICLES will receive full color.
$7,900 - SCENES will receive full color.
$8,900 - CHARACTERS will receive full color.
$10K - ITEMS will receive full color.
$10K+ - For every additional $500, backers get 10 images from my stock art catalog.
None of the illustrations on this page are part of this project. Rather, they are samples of the quality to expect.
All illustrations may be used for personal and commercial projects.
       The following apply to any commercial use:
May be cropped, flipped, or colored.
Signature mark should be included in the final composition.
Signature mark must remain in its original orientation.
Must credit 'Jeshields' for any use.
May be used indefinitely.
May NOT be used in products sold primarily for artistic value.
        (Stock art, tokens, posters, etc)
May NOT be used in works overtly deemed racist, sexist, or sexually explicit.

updates.update_content:
My wife and children went out of town last week due to a family emergency. I took the opportunity and worked nearly non-stop to finish this project. Below are all the COVERS and SCENES created. I hope that is enough for those of you who were on the fence about which genre you wanted to select.
PLEASE NOTE: Each of the Covers and Scenes are split into three layers plus possible variants. Therefore, there are portions of artwork you're not seeing when viewing the images below. It's all to give you more options and customization. I will be rolling out delivery within the next several days, so keep an eye on your inbox! Again, thank you for your patience with this project. Along with several life interruptions, It was larger than I anticipated but I hope the value more than makes up for that mistake.

So, I still haven't hit my target, but I do have progress to share. Hope you enjoy the artwork. I have several variants on these scenes that need to be completed and then I will be on to Covers. To be honest, I did get more distracted by the development and update of my website, Jeshields.com than I would have liked. Something I hope you can forgive me for. After I complete this project, I will be awarding every backer store credit as an expression of gratitude.

(Also, except for a single illustration, I have not taken on any other freelance projects that are scheduled start before I complete this one.)

I told myself I would do better updating you, but here November has come and gone since the last update. I realize part of the issue is planning to update you on Fridays, but the end of the week is a horrible time to do that when I am trying to crunch in the last bit of work that I can. Regardless, I have more art and pushing to be done this month. I would really like to be a part of Kickstarter's January Make 100 project and in order to do that, I need to be done here.
So, you've read the title. What remains?

The end of October has come and gone. As I am sure you are aware, I had plans to be done by now. I realize now that my adjusted schedule was not realistic. Had I not moved in the middle of this project, then I'm positive things would be different.

I am still keeping this project as a priority in November. I hope that despite the delay, it still retains an incredible value for you and your future projects. Below is a preview of several characters I've created from your submissions. Each has two or three variants not shown.

I am finally settled in to our new home and internet is hooked up. I'm back to cranking out the artwork. I am happy to report that the vehicles for this project are practically complete. I only have one more and its variant before they are finished. I'm still pushing to complete the art by the end of the month. Aside from a few small projects, it is my only focus.
Below are previews of 5 of the 19 completed illustrations. Back to work!

Summer has flown by so quickly. A large part of it was eaten up by a project that I vastly underestimated time-wise. This unfortunately pushed back the date that I wanted to be working nearly solely on this project. Regardless, I gave myself a release date of October to account for setbacks like this.
In two days, my family and I will be on the road for a family trip and move to another state. That will give the remaining weeks of September and all of October to complete this project. To be honest, it will probably be tight. Regardless, the only expense to this project is my time, so it will be completed.

I want to say thank you to everybody for your input on the polls. I have processed all the results and have what I believe will be the final selections.  To keep an element of surprise, I will reveal the results as I illustrate them.
Seen below are the fonts - Police Typewriter, Lovecraft Symbols, and Alien Crop Font. These are fully functional fonts in TTF and OTF  formats. Well, except for Police Typewriter. I still need to get that processed, but all the characters are complete.

campaign.story:
The Epic of Dreams RPG is a Diceless Role-Playing Game which features easy to learn rules that foster a Pinnacle immersive Role-Play experience. 
Instead of using dice as a resolution mechanic, we use a number guessing game called "The Circle of The Muse".  
The GM (called the Singer of Tales) decides a hidden range of numbers in their mind, and asks the Hero Players to guess the numbers they're thinking of (with their own number range).
If any numbers match, the Hero succeeds at the task they're struggling to accomplish. 
This minimizes mental math, and time spent thinking "out of character". We want the mechanical tempo of gameplay to be lightning fast - to keep the drama and fantasy thick, building up that sweet sweet immersive role-play experience. 
You can always choose to roll a D20 for your Circle Check if you prefer! 
GM's can roll a D20 or verbally confirm their Checks after each Circle if desired.
The Epic of Dreams is setting neutral; easily adapting to any world, while excelling at epic fantasy storytelling. Learn to build worlds of your very own, or use your favorites from books and film! In addition, The Epic of Dreams is compatible with any RPG adventure module or setting - As long as you have the lore, you have it all! 
The Basilisk Edition will feature the Physical and PDF release of the overhauled Epic of Dreams RPG! Where our last offering was full-sized, this time we wanted to produce the book in a cost-efficient way that would still deliver the experience we wanted. 
The Basilisk Edition will be printed in a softcover A5 format, with 200+ pages of resources.
We are offering our standard Softcover experience, but for our Kickstarter Backers, we are offering a Kickstarter Exclusive Alternate Art Hardcover copy. 
We're only printing this Once.
From Players
“I really enjoyed it. It was a little chaotic, but I know it's in the spirit of the game. I just had to reprogram my brain. I really like being able to do anything. I can really use just my sword, my shield, and my feet. It's just great. You're making me resent dice though and I don't like that lol.”
"The fluidity of combat was amazing. The fact that I can use my whole imagination and that I'm not bound to a specific weapon was really nice."
"As a first-timer I really enjoyed it. I had friends who played LARPs and RPGs but I never played because I thought I didn't have the chops for it. But I tried this one, and enjoyed how easy it was to figure out!"
"Reach and how to actually perform actions were incredibly easy. I feel like I could remember the rules ten years from now without having to reread the book."
"I really like how when you cast a spell, it's not just checking off a resource from a pool - it's a very personal, risky endeavor. Things can go wrong or weird - and the arcane is supposed to be chaotic and strange. [The Epic of Dreams] really nails that aspect."
 "5 sessions in and I get emotional over the death of a pre-gen? This game does things to me." 
“Cinematically, it was one of the best battles I've probably been a part of. Every fight of EoD feels like it could be our last, and man, my character is real upset with how things went down. I like the unbound aspect of it. In D&D I would have never tried to carry a wounded friend off the battlefield.”
  From Game Masters
“The system is easy to learn, so I was able to throw together some bad guys on the fly. They were just the power level I intended them to be! It is rare for me to make stuff on the fly that fast for any system.”
 "I wish we could've played longer. Everyone was there, ready to play and focused the whole time." 
"The Muse character is such a cool idea, and it's so convenient. [By knowing my Muse's characteristics] I was able to figure out how to make new encounters mid-session. I imagined 'Green Eyes, Scowling', and I knew the quest-giver would get offended at how the Barbarian destroyed the white tiger pelt, and try to deny the players out of their pay."
"I love how seamless everything is. I can just focus on my NPCs and enemies and how they're feeling in the moment. I don't need to think about stats or DC's because they're always obvious. It's pretty great actually."
”For monster stats I just thought "What traits would they have?" and went from there. As for running it, it was nice to have that as an option - where if I'm playing D&D or what have you it’s kinda hard to know exactly what stats a given monster would have. With other RPGs I can come up with them, but it takes many weeks of reading books and playing to get to that point. [With the Epic of Dreams] I was able to do it session 1!”
   The Circle of the Muse: an Intuitive 'Guessing Game' D20 Core Mechanic where Players match Number Ranges to succeed their "Dice Rolls" - Dice are Optional!

 Story Focused Hero Characters: By knowing your backstory by heart, and remembering 2 Core Stats, you can discern your entire character sheet on the fly! The Epic of Dreams never limits character concepts by game rules. We also feature intensive Character Creation prompts to create deep, rounded, compelling characters - invaluable for any RPG - as well as Quickstart Character Creation.

 Pinnacle Drama Mechanics: Featuring gamified Soliloquies, as well as two different forms of 'Inspiration' points. The Epic of Dreams teaches how fun immersive role-play can get. Everyone at your table will be glued to the scene and obsessed with what happens next.

 A Truly "Magical" Setting-Neutral Magic System:  In The Epic of Dreams, Story reigns above Rules, and the same is true for our Magic System. Each Ritual cast in The Epic of Dreams has 5 potential outcomes: "Exceed", "Succeed", "Strange", "Fizzle", and "Backfire". Where many RPG's go to great lengths to determine exact spell effects, The Epic of Dreams instead focuses on a ritual effects', boundaries, and limits - based on a spell's lore, the caster's Measure of Power, and the actual Ritual outcome. Magic is never treated like a gun in a video-game, but rather a small part of a greater spiritual practice.

 The Circle of War: A new intense, 'initiative'-less, Combat System where Rounds happen in 3 recurring Phases: "Decision", "Resolution", and "Consequence". The Circle of War is itself a visual cue - placed like a halo of death over where the most carnage lay. In each phase, all combatants act at once, but the speaking order begins with those farthest from the Circle, snaking towards it, with those in the center speaking last. Like a powder keg, everything explodes at once, and every single round, something dreadfully unexpected is bound to happen because of it. Dungeon crawls in The Epic of Dreams are insane. 

 The Muse Herself: Players get to have their pet characters, why not the GM too? In The Epic of Dreams, the Muse is a demigod-like character that embodies both the audience and the rules of the game itself. The GM partners with the Muse, reading their facial expressions throughout gameplay, using their reactions to inform new scenes. Muses can be any kind of character - the more developed their story and the more detailed their tastes, the more depth a GM can use their relationship to summon new, brilliant scenes - seemingly out of thin air.

 Improvisational GM Guide: In addition to the Muse, The Epic of Dreams contains a score of resources aimed at developing GM's into the best storytellers they can be - and how to apply these principles to dream up entire campaigns with minimal prep. (Incredibly useful, regardless of whatever RPG one is actually playing)

 Easy to Produce Monster Stat-Blocks: All beings share the same stats in the Epic of Dreams; thus, if one gains enough 'system mastery' to intuit their Hero character on the fly, the same is true for any monster they read about or imagine. If you know the Lore, Level, and the Order Class - you're set to bring that beast to livid life. 

 Bestiary Sourcebook of World Folklore and Mythology: We utilize the tropes and archetypes from Mythology in storytelling and other parts of life everywhere. In The Epic of Dreams, we use Mythology as a framework and reference point to better understand both modern fantasy works, and more easily create compelling worlds and monsters of our own. We offer an extensive look into the past, with over 300+ classic and obscure beings from the memory of pre-modern man.

 100% Original Art from the Author: Drew has been drawing dragons his entire life. All of the art in the new edition will be penned from his own hand (with a couple extra awesome pieces from very talented painter Joshua Lopez).
Our original 2018 edition had some flaws. This time around, the Basilisk Edition aims to fix them with a commitment to Newcomer-Friendly, Streamlined Rules Presentation. You can download this Quickstart Sheet (and a bunch more awesome stuff) inside the Basilisk Edition Playtest Kit below!

What if I told you, you could play as any character you imagined, and you can use your Backstory AS your character sheet? 
The Epic of Dreams is both streamlined enough that you once you learn how, you don't need pens, paper, dice, or Character Sheets to play; 
AND, the game has enough depth that all the choices in your Backstory sculpt your individual Hero character as nuanced, optimized, and one-of-a-kind.
An Example Character on our Variant Illustrated Character Sheet!
The Epic of Dreams doesn't limit you for not having prerequisite feats or punish you for not understanding attack matrixes. The sum of its rules are designed to keep math out of your head and keep you thinking in character as much as possible.
Our fights are quick, intense, and deadly. Our magic system is ridiculously customizable and so rules-lite that Ritual entries in the book are just descriptor fluff plus a few coded adjectives. Every spell cast actually feels magical. There is no 'save-or-suck' and there are no cookie cutter spell effects.
Why are you waiting to play games that confine your character moves based on arbitrary grid rules? Why are you wasting your time rifling through a mathy resume when you can instead be fully enveloped inside a crazy fantasy movie starring you and your best friends -
EVERY.  SINGLE.  MOMENT?
Your time is invaluable, and you deserve to have your game time chock full with fierce, vivid memories - where the worlds and the enemies ahead are so real you could feel them.  This is an average game session in The Epic of Dreams.
Witness an example below. 

What if I told you, you could run a session where your players are actually invested in the story YOU want so badly to tell with them? 
What if I told you, you could make the lore and worldbuilding you've spent so much time on feel  REAL, and present them to your players with actual weight?
Furthermore, what if you could run the best RPG session of your life - without any notes, dice, or a screen? Taking the fantastic world in your heart, and being able to port it into an RPG system instantaneously, and seamlessly?
The sum of The Epic of Dreams' parts weave together in a magical way, creating a gameplay dynamic that sucks both yourself -and your players- deep into a boiling, wild fantasy drama. In the same way that your players' brains won't be laden down by 'game rules elements' and thrust into our immersive gameplay - so will you! Because each part of the game is designed to defining things through mutual interpretation and minimal maths, you're not allocating your mind to focus on mechanics. 
When you reach system mastery, the game 'clicks', and it's all like the back of your hand. You can then devote all of your synapses to creating the most compelling adventure, and really make your players believe in the world hidden in your heart.
This game has undergone over seven years of playtesting. We have forged it such that it will never get in the way of the story you want to tell, and elevate the elements of the world you want to play in. Also, because the game defines it's numerics based on story and lore - The Epic of Dreams is compatible with ANY adventure module, for ANY system. 
We know the epic story you want to tell- 
And we want nothing less than to help you sing it like Dante himself.

CAMPAIGN OVERVIEW
Maximum Apocalypse: The Roleplaying Game is based on the acclaimed board game series of the same name. In Maximum Apocalypse: RPG, players take on the roles of survivors of one of many apocalypses, adventuring across the ravaged wasteland attempting to survive the many dangers that lurk around every corner. In order to survive, you will need to scavenge and craft new items while also scrounging for food and fighting off everything from zombies to an alien invasion. 
Survival is not guaranteed; there are a multitude of ways to encounter death. Alien Invaders harvest survivors for organic components; Robots seek a utopia free from humans, and Zombies are insatiable stalkers. Maximum Apocalypse: the Roleplaying Game combat is a savage and brutal exchange of attacks against overwhelming odds.
Along with their companions, players use dice, teamwork, ingenuity, and special abilities to accomplish goals and overcome obstacles. Standing alive together when the smoke clears is the ultimate goal of Maximum Apocalypse: The Roleplaying game. Can you survive the apocalypse?
Download the Free Quickstart Guide Here
We are looking to embrace Maximum Apocalypse's artwork and will be printing all of our books in graphic novel softcover format (7" x 10") in full color.  We have included estimated page counts for each product but these page counts are subject to change based on production and potential unlocks during the campaign. 
All books will be fulfilled digitally through DriveThruRPG
We have two different pledge levels that feature digital rewards. The $10 digital pledge gets you the core rulebook in PDF and the higher digital bundle gets you every PDF for $30.
Maximum Apocalypse: The Roleplaying Game's Core Rulebook will be a 7” x 10” softcover full-color book of ~96 pages. The book will feature Gustav Rangmar’s extraordinary artwork throughout along with some commissioned pages of other artists. 
All the core rules for the game
10 Different Character Archetypes
11 Different Personal Apocalypses you may have survived
Details on Crafting, Combat Rounds and Vehicle Chases
Additional tables, appendices and charts to make playing the game easier
Maximum Apocalypse: RPG's Monster Manual will be a 7” x 10” softcover full-color book of at least 60 pages. The Monster Manual presents a horde of post-apocalyptic enemies and monsters, including aliens, zombies, robots, and even supernatural creatures that players may encounter as they explore the apocalyptic wasteland. Each entry features easy-to-use game statistics and artwork to feed your imagination.
Each Entry is categorized by apocalypse
Quickly lookup stats, traits, and special abilities
An Essential Resource for Game Masters
Maximum Apocalypse: Game Master's Guide will be a 7” x 10” softcover full-color book of ~96 pages. This Guide examines how to use the Maximum Apocalypse RPG rules to create environments and formulate your own scenarios. It is the essential book for Game Masters and when combined with the Monster Manual, makes the perfect set of tools to run any adventure.
3+ Premade Scenarios that you can dive right into
Additional tables, charts and resources to make running a session a breeze
Additional rules, clarifications and examples
16" x 10" Quick Reference Screen organizes all the useful charts and tables right in front of you
We always like to offer more to our Kickstarter backers. If you back now and spread the word... we just might be able to squeeze more into these books!
For more details on a specific Stretch Goal, check our updates.
Characters are customized based on 5 Core Aspects: their primary archetype, secondary archetype, personal apocalypse, age, and a lucky mutation.  Character creation is a straightforward process.  All characters start with the same base stats which are then augmented based on your choices.
If you are familiar with the board game, you know about the many different survivor classes in the game.  The first things players do is select a primary and secondary archetype based on these classes.  You can be a Gunslinging Priest or a Firefighting Thief or select the same archetype twice.
The world of Maximum Apocalypse has suffered several society ending calamities.  You will select a personal apocalypse that your character survived whether that's a zombie apocalypse, food riots, or an alien invasion. This apocalypse will give your character an edge fighting certain enemy types and other bonuses.
Last but not least you will select your age and roll a die for a lucky mutation.  A youthful age will boost your stats but means you haven't been around long enough to become proficient at the many skills you'll need to survive.  Mutations range from being quick on your feet to being born with a psychic ability.
Download Character Sheets Here
Maximum Apocalypse RPG gameplay is broken up into two distinct phases: The Regular Phase and Combat Rounds.  The regular phase borrows the best parts of rules-light, storytelling games and allows for the freedom of movement, story, and character interaction while still having a robust crafting system for everything that you scavenge along the way.  Combat rounds are more structured action sequences of conflict involving hostile forces and dice rolling.  This allows Maximum Apocalypse RPG to combine the best of both worlds: fast-paced storytelling with gritty and meaningful combat.
Maximum Apocalypse RPG uses a d100 percentile system to easily manage dice rolls and degrees of success. For the most part, all you need are two d10s and to roll under your listed stat for any skill check.  The lower your roll, the better the success: 
Tara, the Thief, is attempting to open a locked door with her Lockpick skill, of which she is Proficient. She rolls her dice and gets a 57 (5 on the 10s die and 7 on the 1s die). Because that is below the 80 of her Agility Stat, she has a Success and the door is unlocked.
For a more in-depth look, check out some of our full play sessions, previews or upcoming streaming schedule below:
Watch the Nerdarchy Stream (streamed 6/9/20)

campaign.story:
Exalted Vales is an elaborate campaign setting for D&D 5e.
It was born from the will of a small group of passionate game industry professionals to bring a unique theme to life: mysticism.
What happens when mystical events are part of everyday life?
What does adventure look like in a city to which thousands of thousands of pilgrims flock everyday to seek the advice of a blind oracle with the power to transcend anyone’s life with a few words?
What is it like to live in a region where everything, from concepts such as loyalty and monetary value to tangible aspects of life such as fertility and dreams, are subject to mystical rules or embodied by mystical beings? Where dreams must be woven by witches to allow the inhabitants of the vales to dream and rest properly?
What if those strange things are just the tip of the iceberg?
As you explore the Exalted Vales, prepare to dive in a world that lives and breathes mysticism.
 The book is about 250 pages, hardcover in full color, with a lot of illustrations. The book is written by Renaud Bartens, veteran of the video game industry, game design consultant and author, who has been running D&D campaign for more than twenty years.
For players, this book offers new races, classes, archetypes, backgrounds and feats to create unique heroes, whether they were born in the strange lands of the Exalted Vales or are simply passing through.
For game masters, it is a complete guide to the mystic region of the Exalted Vales: Locations, characters, mysteries and plenty of help to bring the unique themes of the Exalted Vales to life.
And for the whole party we bring you “A Shadow Among Them”, an epic and mysterious campaign for 1st to 16th level characters that will put their cunning and resourcefulness to the test.
This campaign is shipping friendly to USA, European Union, Australia and Canada. (See the FAQ for details about Canadian shipping.)
Inspiration
The key feature of Exalted Vales is its theme.
Mysticism is a powerful energy in our societies, root of the most vibrant civilizations, incredible architectural feats and unimaginable pilgrimages. But depicting such phenomenal events in our favorite fantasy setting in a comprehensive, but still compelling manner can be quite a tall order for dungeon masters considering all the work they already have on their plate. That is why the Exalted Vales were born, to allow players to experience this unique flavor of play.
A fully realized world
One of the characteristics of mysticism is that it requires more than just “ambiance” to be fully realized. It's not enough to say that the city in which the players arrive is mystical, it must be given substance, strangeness and oddities must wait around every corner.
Exalted Vales gives to the dungeon master the tools and the content they need to fulfill that promise.
In Lusan - the city of a Thousand Oracles - people with strange powers of divination are everywhere. In the clock-makers' district, connoisseurs know where to find Alizager's little stall. This honorable artisan practices a very peculiar trade: he only sells small beautifully crafted wooden boxes. When a customer shows up, he looks into their future to find out when they will open the box, and then he puts exactly what the customer will need at that moment in the box.
A change of scenery 
The result for you, the dungeon master, is a real change of scenery for your players. The Exalted Vales can be added as a peninsula extending from your existing world, or used as its own setting for a new campaign. The guide contains enough material to allow you to play several campaigns before you have to take over with your own mystical creations. And with each description of the mystical Manifestations, there are several hooks for other adventures.
Intrigue and investigation
Existing role-playing scenarios offer players a wide array of battle-oriented adventures. The goal of the campaign "A Shadow Among Them" is not to compete directly with campaigns like these. The campaign is full of action and danger, but the focus is on unraveling the intrigue and mysteries of the story.
 Narrative intention
It is sometimes difficult for a dungeon master to immerse himself in reading a large campaign. Also, a campaign with a grand and expansive plot can be difficult to completely wrap your head around. To address this, our team has over the years developed a very specific method for writing the campaign: establish how the players are supposed to experience each scene (the intended emotional experience), and only then explore the details of the scene.
We begin each scene with a description of why it was written the way it is, the goal we had in mind, and how the players are supposed to feel.
The result is a new approach to presenting a campaign: the narrative intention. The campaign is described in such a way that the reader is presented with the genesis of the story and how progressively, using the rudiments of Joseph Campbell's work, this story is transformed into a campaign.
We believe this approach has great benefits for the dungeon master:
 Familiarization. By following the reasoning that leads to the story before being presented with the finished story, they better understand its inner workings.
   New methods. Following the creation of a campaign step by step with professional narration tools allows you to acquire new methods of storycrafting to use with your own content.
   Improvisation. When a campaign provides its narrative intention and a dungeon master adapts it, improvisation comes more naturally. You know where you are going, you know what your tools are, and the rest comes with ease. And that's when the real improvisation starts, not the kind where we panic and invent a castle and three monsters on the fly, but the kind where we know exactly what the players are supposed to experience in this castle, and adapt content as they choose their own path through it.
  The book is already written and the campaign has been playtested for two years, but we still have a lot of content planned. Help us achieve these goals to make the Exalted Vales an even more exciting guide!
If you want to see a sample of our work, and a taste of the campaign, a free introduction scenario is available to download:
Free introduction scenario

We have designed new Classes, Background features and Archetypes for all the classes of 5th Edition to allow the players to fully immerse themselves in this mystical realm.
When creating a character for the “Shadow Among Them” campaign, you can choose to stay traditional or experience the strange world behind the Tapestry.
All rules are fully compatible with 5th Edition.
Here are some previews:


When time comes to let your players draw a random magic item after an epic battle, or to show them the terrific threat they’re facing, nothing beats a beautiful illustrated card.
 This 50+ card deck contains all the monsters and items as quick and easy to use reference cards. Spend less time digging through the rule book and more time playing!


The core book comes with all battlemaps needed for the campaign. But let’s face it, there are groups of players that just have a knack for getting into unplanned trouble.
Alternatively, some groups play exclusively online.
In both cases, the digital pack has you covered. Our artists realized the surroundings of the areas your players visit during the campaign so you can let them wander freely and with ease.
The second group of battlemaps visit the most iconic places and cities of the Exalted Vales, for even more adventures. 
From our own experience as dungeon masters, we know it's always time consuming to find tokens for each battlemap and each battle.
Therefore, the digital pack contains not only maps, but all tokens for online play. Monsters, characters, npcs and more.
 The digital pack contains 75+ full color squared battlemaps - with and without grid, and more than 50 tokens to flesh out your battles.





Renaud Bartens is a Lead Game designer and writer. Today a consultant in the video game industry, he is at the head of the Exalted Vales project. With over 20 years of experience as a dungeon master, he combines passion of the game, knowledge of game mechanics and writing talent.
Jonathan Lefaucheur has been an artistic director in the video game industry for 12 years. He has participated in dozens of projects, from fighting games with Tekken to zombie invasions with Zombie Night Terror (2016). A huge role-playing fan (especially if he can play an assassin), he oversees artistic cohesion and visual coherence.
Karl Monnerais works in the printing industry. He brings his expertise to ensure that the book will live up to everyone's expectations. New to the world of role-playing, he has only recently discovered the joys of fumbling Stealth checks.
William Martin is coordinator and project manager for the French government and for international organizations. His double cap of organizer and passionate role player ensures a great mastery of the project, mainly with the logistics of shipping. He has participated in the publishing and shipping of illustrated books for children.
Chloé Rondonneau is a delightful artist. She's passionate about her art, and has a magic wand: She waves it above any item, and *pof* you get a cute version of it. Yes, she's (among other things) the one behind the new series of digital tokens based on our illustrations.
 (Battlemaps created in collaboration with https://2minutetabletop.com/)

campaign.story:
A pre-apocalyptic game of eco-espionage, set on a world slowly being killed by humanity’s need to consume.
In the distant future, humanity leaves a dying Earth behind to find a better home. When the pristine world of Terra is found, it soon becomes evident that humanity has learned nothing from their past. The colonists soon discover things are different here: the world is alive and taking resources requires something to be given in return. This time, humanity is literally killing the planet.
Recognizing the world is dying, heroes from all walks of life band together to safeguard the world from humanity's voracious appetite for consumption.
A 96-page, full color, hardback source book for the MYTHIC D6 System
Rules for the use of psychic Gnostic Prana Abilities
Details of the people of Terra Oblivion
Details for new equipment 
New fantastic adversaries
One full-length adventure
     Review a sample of the book HERE.
Terra Oblivion is a supplement using the MYTHIC D6 game system. Playing Terra Oblivion requires the MYTHIC D6 core book, a handful of dice and an awesome attitude.
A look at the MYTHIC D6 system.
Terra Oblivion is a supplement using the MYTHIC D6 game system. Playing Terra Oblivion requires the MYTHIC D6 core book, a handful of dice and an awesome attitude.
A look at the MYTHIC D6 system.
The single most significant influence on this book is the artwork done by Steven S. Sanders. Without his work, this book would not exist in its present form. Steven’s work can be seen at the link below.
https://www.artstation.com/stevensanders
Other Influences include:
 Nausicaä of the Valley of the Wind by Hayao Miyazaki
 The Rocketeer comic series by Dave Stevens
 The Indiana Jones trilogy of movies (I said trilogy, did I stutter)
The classic movie Casablanca
  The players of Terra Oblivion take on roles as agents of Terra, ordinary people that see how humanity is strip-mining their new home, and who have the will to stop it.
 $15- Electronic Only. Get the PDF edition of the Terra Oblivion Source book.
 $30- Electronic Only. The PDF of the MYTHIC D6 core book, and the PDF of the Terra Oblivion Source book.
 $30- Print and PDF. The Terra Oblivion Source book in Print and PDF.
 $80- Print and PDF. The MYTHIC D6 core book in print and PDF, and the Terra Oblivion Source book in Print and PDF.
 $200- Print and PDF. The MYTHIC D6 core book in print and PDF, and the Terra Oblivion Source book in Print and PDF. Plus, you get your very own personal game, run by me Jerry “Dirty Navel” Grayson!
Hey! Where are all the other stretch goals?
There aren’t any. With this project, I’m interested in making one great source book; Terra Oblivion, not Terra Oblivion plus a ton of other things I have only a passing interest in producing. Terra Oblivion is what I’m excited about, and this is what I want to create. Anything over the intended amount is great and will go into making this book better, bonuses for talents, and giving me just that much more resources for the next product.
Starting with GODSEND Agenda, HELLAS, ATLANTIS: The Second Age, and MYTHIC D6, I've created many successful Kickstarter gaming projects enjoyed by many. Now I am focusing on Terra Oblivion.
With the help of other talented men and women, I've created products for PDF and physical print and maintained a level of consistency and quality that rivals larger publishers.
You may have noticed that there are no additional charges for shipping. This is intentional.
Because  shipping cost is one of the biggest issues in a Kickstarter, this time  around I have decided that the onus to pay the fair share of the  shipping falls to the backer. I know that sounds harsh, but I’m actually  trying to save people money in the long run. Rather than increasing the  cost of each reward level by a static amount to try and predict total  shipping costs, I’m completely individualizing the process.
When  the project is ready to ship, everyone who is entitled to physical items  will be given a special coupon code that may be used to purchase the  item for $0+shipping.
I know this isn't how it’s usually done but this helps in several ways:
This helps make the Kickstarter successful and takes out the hidden  variables created by the hardships of International Shipping Rates.
It takes some of the burden off my shoulders and allows me to focus on producing the game.
It allows you to know with certainty that the generosity you afford me goes 100% toward the project you funded.
It allows me to ask for less money knowing that I don’t have to factor in 2-3 thousand dollars for shipping.
It allows you to control how and when you want your items shipped.
Thank you for your understanding and your generosity.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Khepera Publishing is an experienced RPG publisher. I’ve produced several role-playing games in a variety of formats since 2002. This puts me in an excellent position to take on the risks and challenges that will arise; and as with any project, experience tells me a few problems likely will.

Problems that could arise, 
• Artists who turn out to be slow (Not an issue on this one)
• Creators who suffer illness with no form of support to keep the project going. 
• Writer deciding to re-write everything. 
• Lack of effective communication

If these things happen, I will be a responsible human being and address the issue and move past the problem. This kickstarter isn’t just a small-time pie in the sky hobby project; this is a business. You’ve given me money with the expectation that you will get what was promised.

• The artist that’s too slow? Build in more lead time or get a different artist to finish the project. 
• The creator takes ill. That would be me. If that occurs, there are capable people that I know who will step in and complete the project. But since the majority (90%) of the writing is done, this is not an issue. If I die, I can see this being a problem. I’m going to address by keeping my fingers crossed. 
• The writer decided to rewrite everything? I’m done writing the book, and two things prevent me from rewriting it. 1- I’m lazy, 2- my massive ego says its perfect as is. Your mileage may vary. 
• Lack of Communication. I always own up to my failings, and this Kickstarter is no exception. Good human beings do not cheat others that have so generously given them money. I honor the trust that you’ve placed in me. I’m visible, and I own my foibles.

If there is ever a problem with the project that makes things look dire, I will tell you promptly, and we can move forward with the best possible intentions.

If there are any risks or challenges YOU can think of that we haven't mentioned here, please write in and tell me. I’ll try and provide the best possible service for your help.

Thank you.

campaign.story:
PLAY

Role playing games are powerful empathy generators – creating spaces for genuine intimate friendship, adventure, inspiration, and collaboration. Whether you’re an avid tabletop RPG player, creator, streamer, or curious newcomer – we want to share in your passion and help it grow.
We believe in the power of authentic narrative play. With Role, we're bringing that power to a new generation of online creators & communities. With all the world’s advances in technology & entertainment, there is still nothing quite like a great RPG. So we set out to build the ultimate collection of high-quality social, marketplace, and online play tools for veteran players and newcomers alike.
Check out our live gameplay demos!
PLAY

Character Sheets, Dice, Assets, & Video!
PLAY

Tokens & Whiteboarding!
Today’s role playing community is larger and more vibrant than ever. Diverse voices from around the globe are creating new games every day. We want to be the place where everyone can play, meet new people, and get their games into more players’ hands. In simplest terms, we really just want to answer one question for every person in our community: What’s missing from your table today?
We try to answer that question in 3 major ways: intuitive & seamless online video play, a creator-driven marketplace, and robust player matching services.
Our online play interface is called "The Table", and is meant to recreate that intimate feeling of playing face-to-face with a tight group of players. 
Crisp high quality video chat puts the best part of the game front-and-center: the people. Show critical information through screen sharing. Upload visual aids to enhance your game via your Asset Tray. Text chat as a group or privately, allowing you to communicate however is most effective for your game.
Roll any combination of dice by selecting them quickly from your Dice Tray. Add stat modifiers from your character sheet, track critical successes & failures, and add up your totals automatically. Draw cards from any deck of your choosing, including standard 52 card decks, tarot, and custom decks from your favorite games. Show your results live to the entire Table, or set them to Private for discreet gameplay.
Fully modular character sheet tools ensure you have what you need to play any game, even homebrew content or custom systems. We've designed our character sheet system from a standardized set of form fields, stat trackers, pools, tokens, note sections, and more - everything you need to play any RPG system. Character sheets are automatically indexed, with a Table of Contents generated for easy navigation. Everything is drag-and-drop - no code required! 
Match with players who share your interests, based on information listed in your Profile. Use advanced filters to find exactly who you need based on desired complexity level, specific game experience, and location. You can even use Role to find experienced Game Masters to run your Table! 
Role is a people-first role playing community, and that means you’ll always have tools to meet new players that align with your interests. Browse until you find someone you want to match with. If they match back, you’ll be able to chat and set up your next game together!
Real names & location data are always optional – you only have to share what you’re comfortable sharing.
We’re designing a premium marketplace that puts creators first, making it easier for players to discover, learn, and purchase new games from diverse voices in the role playing community. Basic game info such as complexity, player count, and time commitment is always easy to find & search by. Creators can upload a free teaser of their game to help players quickly understand the basics, sample the world, and get excited to play more.
Say goodbye to review bombs & trolling. Instead of a traditional review score system, Role uses a recommendation engine. Players recommend what they love, not trash what they hate.
Players never have to worry about buying new games without people to enjoy them with. Every game is directly linked to our Player Matching tools, ensuring that every new player can find people and play together.
Backers of this campaign will be the first to join the Role private Early Access program, where they can play with each other and help shape our tools before we launch to the rest of the world! In addition, we're offering a slate of rewards that include premium features, game supplements, and exclusive items only available via this campaign.
All of our backers will be able to play in our Early Access program, and will receive a shout-out on our "Thank You" page! Additional rewards are available as follows:
We're FUNDED! Every dollar raised from here goes towards unlocking our STRETCH GOALS:
Our first Stretch Goal has been unlocked! 
Role will launch as a free platform for everyone, with an open marketplace & play tools to support any game. For those that want to take their adventures further, we're offering a subscription tier called Role Master Edition. This subscription includes everything from the basic tier, plus extras that ensure players, creators, and game masters alike have all the tools they need to run the very best game sessions.
Beyond our default look & feel, the Table interface will support a growing library of custom skins inspired by various popular fiction genres. Maximize your group's immersion in the story by wrapping your experience in a skin that's right for you. 
Backers of this campaign will receive 3 Kickstarter-exclusive skins that will never be available again: our first Fantasy skin, a retro Arcade skin, and our Cyberpunk skin. 
Of course, the heart of the Role platform is great games. Backers of this campaign will be able to receive one or more of our 6 Creators Program supplements as they release over the course of our first year.
PLAY

We believe in supporting the RPG creator community on Day 1, and that's why we've launched the Role Creators Program - a funding initiative to help independent designers and publishers get more of their work out into the world. As part of this Kickstarter campaign, we're funding a fresh batch of RPG game supplements from 6 different creators. These digital supplements will be exclusive to the Role platform, and available first to backers of this campaign!
First, we're extremely excited to reveal Lancer: Battlegroup, the official expansion from Massif Press!
Lancer: Battlegroup is a new, standalone rules system for the Lancer setting, designed for use at your tabletop and in digital, grid-free play. Blending Lancer’s deep unit customization and imbued story with tactical-narrative action, Battlegroup casts the players as pilots and officers in a battlegroup deployed to the front line; as the first tremors of interstellar war test Union’s integrity, you and your party members will face the enemy with new weapons and old tactics, thrown into combat with only one goal: survive, and return home.
As big OSR fans, we're very pleased to bring everyone Isle of Ixx from Swedish designer, Skullfungus!
The Isle of Ixx is both a light OSR-style ruleset and a sandbox adventure in one. The rules are based on "Into the Odd" by Chris McDowall, and have been chosen for their simplicity and ease of use, so that the focus can lie on adventuring and discovering the island. The system itself is also easy to adapt to any style of OSR-ruleset you might have in mind, should you prefer that instead!
The setting text will be written in an open-ended way, often asking the players questions about their characters and surroundings. This way, they'll be a big part of the setting and will get to influence much of what goes on in the story!
There will be roughly 16 key locations on the map for players to explore, ranging from cities, villages, lairs, and dungeons. There will also be tools for the game master to create their own content, in the form of generators and sample maps they can use for their own dungeon adventures!
 We're also proud to be partnering with Swordsfall to launch The Fifth Ebon Expedition, the newest expansion to this massive Afropunk universe!
The Fifth Ebon Expedition is a 4+ player campaign set in a unique Mission style. Your group will be part of the larger expedition, fighting to establish forward camps, and with it a railway for a future supply line. If your expedition is successful, then the question is... can you defend it?
From popular Filipino creator, Sword Queen Games, we're bringing Voidwalkers - a tarot-powered game that combines mysticism with deep space exploration for an experience unlike any other!
Voidwalkers will be a complete stand-alone science fiction TTRPG where mysticism and space-magic guide creative and intuitive stories. In this Powered by the Apocalypse game, characters must learn how to harness and balance the wild space-magic, the VOID, within themselves, while navigating and staying clear of its wild manifestations in the physical world. You must rely on creativity, luck, and relationships in order to succeed and thrive out in the Void. Players will use a tarot deck as a way to generate intuitive stories and resolve challenges. A unique tarot deck will be created for this game, but any tarot deck may be used!
Indie designer Steven Medeiros, in collaboration with the Role team, is developing Astra - a unique blend of classic OSR and cooperative action where players pool their dice rolls and act together as a group.
Astra is a rules light 3-6 player OSR-style tabletop role playing game with a focus on cooperative group dice pool mechanics that allow players to work together and overcome obstacles. It explores heavy themes of interpersonal connections, self exploration, and building community. Suitable for one-shot or campaign-style play, it features quick & easy character creation and narrative driven gameplay.
Last - but certainly not least - we're working with Magpie Games to bring players a brand-new supplement for Masks! Cataclysm at the Metajunction will bring new levels of superhero action to this popular superhero RPG.
Cataclysm at the Metajunction is a playset for Masks: A New Generation, a Powered by the Apocalypse game of teen superheroics. This playset will give you everything you need to play through superheroic tales in the endangered Metajunction, along with two new costumes, or playbook variants, for you to use with existing Masks characters. Ever wanted to play a version of your character from another reality? Cataclysm at the Metajunction provides the support for doing just that!
This playset includes: a 32 page full-color, illustrated playset, including custom moves and villains. And 2 new playbook supplements (costumes) that expand existing Masks playbooks.
All 6 of these awesome supplements will release exclusively on Role, as part of Year 1 of our platform launch!
 From all of us here at Role, thank you so much for joining us on this adventure. We can't wait to share in the worlds, characters, and stories you create. The world is a better place when we imagine together.
This is your game table. This is Role. 
Welcome home! <3
